title: Menominee–Marinette Twin County Airport
text:
Menominee Regional Airport is a public use <a href="airport">airport</a> located 1 <a href="mile">mile</a> (2 <a href="kilometre">km</a>) northwest of the <a href="central%20business%20district">central business district</a> of <a href="Menominee%2C%20Michigan">Menominee, Michigan</a>, a city in <a href="Menominee%20County%2C%20Michigan">Menominee County, Michigan</a>, United States. It is included in the <a href="Federal%20Aviation%20Administration">Federal Aviation Administration</a> (FAA) <a href="National%20Plan%20of%20Integrated%20Airport%20Systems">National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems</a> for 2021–2025, in which it is <a href="FAA%20airport%20categories">categorized</a> as a local <a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a> facility.
Facilities and aircraft.
Menominee Regional Airport covers an area of 600 <a href="acre">acre</a>s (243 <a href="hectare">ha</a>) at an <a href="elevation">elevation</a> of 624 feet (190 m) above <a href="mean%20sea%20level">mean sea level</a>. It has two <a href="runway">runway</a>s: 3/21 is 5,999 by 100 feet (1,828 x 30 m) with an asphalt surface; and 14/32 is 5,101 by 100 feet (1,555 x 30 m) with an asphalt surface. Both runways have approved GPS approaches.
For the 12-month period ending December 31, 2017, the airport had 7,878 aircraft operations, an average of 22 per day: 92% general aviation and 8% air taxi.
In November 2021, there were 40 aircraft based at this airport: 31 single-engine, 3 multi-engine and 6 helicopter.
Historical commercial service.
Up until 1979, roughly contemporaneous with <a href="airline%20deregulation">airline deregulation</a>, regional carrier <a href="North%20Central%20Airlines">North Central Airlines</a> provided commercial air passenger service to Twin County Airport. Service was available to the following destinations (not all destinations were available at the same period): <a href="Escanaba%2C%20MI">Escanaba, MI</a>: <a href="Delta%20County%20Airport">Delta County Airport</a>; <a href="Green%20Bay%2C%20WI">Green Bay, WI</a>: <a href="Green%20Bay%E2%80%93Austin%20Straubel%20International%20Airport">Green Bay–Austin Straubel International Airport</a>; <a href="Milwaukee%2C%20WI">Milwaukee, WI</a>: <a href="Milwaukee%20Mitchell%20International%20Airport">Milwaukee Mitchell International Airport</a>; and <a href="Chicago%2C%20IL">Chicago, IL</a>: <a href="O%27Hare%20International%20Airport">O'Hare International Airport</a>. <a href="Republic%20Airlines">Republic Airlines</a> (successor to North Central) continued limited service to Twin County Airport until 1981, with direct flights available to Milwaukee, WI.
